items.title: England World Cup subs might stay indoors - Tuchel

items.title: Usyk can make voluntary defence v Wilder - WBC
items.summary: Oleksandr Usyk has permission to face Deontay Wilder next in a voluntary defence of his WBC heavyweight title.

items.title: From out-shining Palmer to a new start and FA Cup joy at Buxton
items.summary: Tai Sodje outscored Cole Palmer as Manchester City teenagers, now at 22 he is building his senior career at non-league FA Cup hopefuls Buxton.

items.title: Hislop being treated for aggressive prostate cancer
items.summary: Former Premier League goalkeeper Shaka Hislop says he has an aggressive form of prostate cancer, and urges men of Caribbean heritage to get tested for the disease.

items.title: Horror film character? 'I don't waste energy on that' - Verstappen in-depth on F1 title race
items.summary: Max Verstappen looks forward to the F1 title showdown in Abu Dhabi, acknowledges that he is probably in his rivals' heads and discusses his intense competitiveness.

items.title: 'I've never met anyone like Pollock' - George on England's 'brilliant idiot'
items.summary: Jamie George says England team-mate Henry Pollock is a personality without precedent in rugby and a "genuinely fascinating" character.

items.title: Joshua on weight for Paul fight as undercard confirmed
items.summary: Anthony Joshua is on weight for his heavyweight fight with Jake Paul later this month.

items.title: 'No more Average Joe as Root century seals all-time great status'
items.summary: Joe Root finally hitting the elusive Test century in Australia proves his status as one of the all-time great batters, says chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt.

items.title: Volcanic eruption triggered 'butterfly effect' that led to the Black Death, researchers find
items.summary: A volcanic eruption in 1345 may have kicked off a series of events that led to the Black Death sweeping through medieval Europe.

items.title: The World Cup draw is here - this is how it will work
items.summary: Pots, quadrants, confederation constraints, group position grids ... the World Cup draw is not going to be straightforward.

items.title: Real Madrid's Alexander-Arnold out for two months
items.summary: England defender Trent Alexanderâ€‘Arnold will be out for about two months after sustaining a thigh injury during Real Madrid's win over Athletic Club.

items.title: 18,000 dinosaur tracks discovered along ancient Bolivian coastline â€” and they set a new record
items.summary: Researchers have counted 16,600 fossilized dinosaur footprints and 1,378 swim tracks at a site in Bolivia that showcase a variety of behaviors and different theropods from the Cretaceous period.

items.title: 'The best player I've ever played with' - Crawley 'chuffed' for Root
items.summary: Zak Crawley says he and his England teammates were "chuffed" after Joe Root scored his first century in Australia, finishing on 135 not out to help England close on 325-9 at stumps on day one of the second Ashes Test against Australia in Brisbane.

items.title: InnAIO AI Translator T10 Review: Feature-Loaded but Needs Work
items.summary: The InnAIO T10 clips magnetically to the back of your phone, but it needs further development to be worth the money.

items.title: McIlroy produces 'rollercoaster' opening round
items.summary: Rory McIlroy describes his one-over par round of 72 at the Australian Open at Royal Melbourne as a "rollercoaster".

items.title: 'Gifted Australia a wicket' - Vaughan baffled by Brook dismissal
items.summary: Former England captain Michael Vaughan is left dismayed as Harry Brook is caught for 31 by Steve Smith off the bowling of Mitchell Starc as England fall to 176-4 on the opening day of the second Ashes Test in Brisbane.

items.title: 'Have I just outed Chelsea?' - Confession Cam
items.summary: In this Chelsea edition of Confession Cam, players including Hannah Hampton, Aggie Beever-Jones, Keira Walsh and Erin Cuthbert reveal their most embarrassing moments, football icks and what football rule they would like to change.

items.title: British athletes given AI app as shield from online abuse
items.summary: British Olympic and Paralympic athletes are to be offered a new form of artificial intelligence-based protection from online abuse.

items.title: 'Excitement and nerves' for Archibald as Games loom
items.summary: Katie Archibald has already competed in a Commonwealth Games in Glasgow and is eager to do so again next summer.

items.title: Crawley falls for 76 as Australia make key breakthrough after lunch
items.summary: Zak Crawley is caught for 76 off the bowling of Michael Neser, ending a 117-run partnership with Joe Root to leave England on 122-3 on day one of the second Ashes Test in Brisbane.

items.title: Weekly sports quiz: Which keeper did Haaland score his 100th goal against?
items.summary: How much attention have you paid to what's happened in the world of sport over the past seven days?

items.title: Crawley reaches fifty as England fight back on opening day of second Test
items.summary: Zak Crawley brings up his half-century to help England recover from 5-2 to 98-2 at lunch on day one of the second Ashes Test against Australia in Brisbane.

items.title: 'I feared failure' - why Savage left club that 'saved' him
items.summary: Four years on from film crews witnessing Macclesfield FC's rise from the ashes, a new documentary follows Robbie Savage as he takes over as manager at the club he helped to create.

items.title: Watch trailer for Robbie Savage: Managing Macclesfield FC
items.summary: Watch the trailer for new BBC documentary Robbie Savage: Managing Macclesfield FC.

items.title: Daily Ashes Debrief: Root is the 'glue' to England success
items.summary: Reaction to day one of the second Test as Joe Root hits his first century in Australia.

items.title: Robbie Savage takes on his first football manager job
items.summary: Robbie Savage takes on his first football manager job, but will he regret it?

items.title: Nomad Goods Promo Codes: 25% Off
items.summary: Save up to 25% on Nomad Goods accessories such as Nomad phone cases, Nomad wallets, and more this December.

items.title: 'I deeply hurt people by moving to Saudi Arabia'
items.summary: In an interview with BBC Sport, Ashleigh Plumptre says she regrets losing the trust of some LGBT fans in women's football by moving to Saudi Arabia.
